CAN exported functions
CAN

Modules

 CAN private functions

Functions

void CAN_DeInit (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Deinitialize the specified CAN registers to their default values.
u32 CAN_SetBaudRate (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate)
 Set bus baud-rate.
void CAN_Close (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 The function is used to disable all CAN interrupt.
u32 CAN_Open (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 wBaudRate, u32 wMode)
 Set CAN operation mode and target baud-rate.
void CAN_CLR_INT_PENDING_BIT (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum)
 Clear interrupt pending bit.
void CAN_EnableInt (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u32Mask)
 Enable CAN interrupt. The application software has two possibilities to follow the source of a message interrupt. First, it can follow the IntId in the Interrupt Register and second it can poll the Interrupt Pending Register.
void CAN_DisableInt (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 Mask)
 Disable CAN interrupt.
s32 CAN_Transmit (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Send CAN message.
s32 CAN_Receive (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Gets the message, if received. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.
s32 CAN_SetRxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure a receive message object.
s32 CAN_SetTxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure a transmit object.
s32 CAN_TriggerTxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u32MsgNum)
 Set transmit request bit. If a transmission is requested by programming bit TxRqst/NewDat (IFn_CMASK[2]), the TxRqst (IFn_MCON[8]) will be ignored.
void CAN_EnterInitMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 This function is used to set CAN to enter initialization mode and enable access bit timing register.After bit timing configuration ready, user must call CAN_LeaveInitMode() to leave initialization mode and lock bit timing register to let new configuration take effect.
void CAN_LeaveInitMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Leave initialization mode.
void CAN_WaitMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 This function is used to Wait message into message buffer in basic mode. Please notice the function is polling NEWDAT bit of MCR register by while loop and it is used in basic mode.
u32 CAN_GetCANBitRate (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Get current bit rate.
void CAN_EnterTestMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 u8TestMask)
 Switch the CAN into test mode.
void CAN_LeaveTestMode (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx)
 Leave the test mode.
u32 CAN_IsNewDataReceived (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj)
 Get the waiting status of a received message.
s32 CAN_BasicSendMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to Send CAN message in BASIC mode of test mode. Before call the API, the user should be call CAN_EnterTestMode(CAN_TEST_BASIC) and let CAN controller enter basic mode of test mode. Please notice IF0 Registers used as Tx Buffer in basic mode.
s32 CAN_BasicReceiveMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Get a message information in BASIC mode.
s32 CAN_SetRxMsgObj (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Set Rx message object.
s32 CAN_ReadMsgObj (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, u32 Release, STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 Gets the message.
s32 CAN_MsgObjMaskConfig (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgObj, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *MaskMsg)
 The function is used to configure Mask as the message object.
s32 CAN_SetMultiRxMsg (HT_CAN_TypeDef *CANx, u32 MsgNum, u32 MsgCount, STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *pCanMsg)
 The function is used to configure several receive message objects. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.

Function Documentation

s32 CAN_BasicReceiveMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

Get a message information in BASIC mode.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
FALSE,:No any message received, TRUE: Receive a message success.

Definition at line 253 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_BasicSendMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

The function is used to Send CAN message in BASIC mode of test mode. Before call the API, the user should be call CAN_EnterTestMode(CAN_TEST_BASIC) and let CAN controller enter basic mode of test mode. Please notice IF0 Registers used as Tx Buffer in basic mode.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure containing data to transmit.
Return values:
TRUE,:Transmission OK, FALSE: Check busy flag of interface 0 is timeout

The function is used to disable all CAN interrupt.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
Return values:
None

void CAN_DisableInt ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  Mask 
)

Disable CAN interrupt.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
Mask,:Interrupt Mask. (CAN_CR_IE_Msk / CAN_CR_SIE_Msk / CAN_CR_EIE_Msk).
Return values:
None

Definition at line 776 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

void CAN_EnableInt ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  u32Mask 
)

Enable CAN interrupt. The application software has two possibilities to follow the source of a message interrupt. First, it can follow the IntId in the Interrupt Register and second it can poll the Interrupt Pending Register.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
u32Mask,:Interrupt Mask.
  • CAN_CR_IE_Msk : Module interrupt enable.
  • CAN_CR_SIE_Msk: Status change interrupt enable.
  • CAN_CR_EIE_Msk: Error interrupt enable.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 758 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

void CAN_EnterInitMode ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx)

This function is used to set CAN to enter initialization mode and enable access bit timing register.After bit timing configuration ready, user must call CAN_LeaveInitMode() to leave initialization mode and lock bit timing register to let new configuration take effect.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
Return values:
None

Definition at line 83 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

void CAN_EnterTestMode ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  u8TestMask 
)

Switch the CAN into test mode.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
u8TestMaskSpecifies the configuration in test modes
  • CAN_TEST_BASIC_Msk : Enable basic mode of test mode
  • CAN_TEST_SILENT_Msk : Enable silent mode of test mode
  • CAN_TEST_LBACK_Msk : Enable Loop Back Mode of test mode
  • CAN_TEST_TX0_Msk/CAN_TEST_TX1_Msk: Control CAN_TX pin bit field
Return values:
None

Get current bit rate.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
Return values:
CurrentBit-Rate (kilo bit per second)

)

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgObj,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31. 0 No message object has new data.

Definition at line 168 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_MsgObjMaskConfig ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgObj,
STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *  MaskMsg 
)

The function is used to configure Mask as the message object.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgObj,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
MaskMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
  • CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
  • CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
Return values:
FALSENo useful interface, TRUE Configure a receive message object success.

Definition at line 946 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

u32 CAN_Open ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  wBaudRate,
u32  wMode 
)

Set CAN operation mode and target baud-rate.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
wBaudRateThe target CAN baud-rate. The range of u32BaudRate is 1~1000KHz.
wModeThe CAN operation mode.
  • CAN_NORMAL_MODE : Normal operation.
  • CAN_BASIC_MODE : Basic operation.
  • CAN_SILENT_MODE : Silent operation.
  • CAN_LBACK_MODE : Loop Back operation.
  • CAN_LBS_MODE : Loop Back combined with Silent operation.
Return values:
u32CurrentBitRateReal baud-rate value.

Definition at line 599 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_ReadMsgObj ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgObj,
u32  Release,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

Gets the message.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgObj,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
Release,:Specifies the message release indicator.
  • TRUE : the message object is released when getting the data.
  • FALSE: the message object is not released.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
TRUESuccess, FALSE No any message received

Definition at line 419 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_Receive ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgNum,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

Gets the message, if received. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgNum,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
FALSE,:No any message received, TRUE: Receive Message success.

Definition at line 896 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

u32 CAN_SetBaudRate ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  wBaudRate 
)

Set bus baud-rate.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
wBaudRate,:The target CAN baud-rate. The range of u32BaudRate is 1~1000KHz.
Return values:
CurrentBitRate,:Real baud-rate value.

Definition at line 531 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_SetMultiRxMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgNum,
u32  MsgCount,
STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

The function is used to configure several receive message objects. The Interface Registers avoid conflict between the CPU accesses to the Message RAM and CAN message reception and transmission by buffering the data to be transferred.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgNum,:The starting MSG RAM number(0 ~ 31).
MsgCount,:the number of MSG RAM of the FIFO.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
  • CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
  • CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
Return values:
FALSENo useful interface, TRUE Configure receive message objects success.

Definition at line 822 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_SetRxMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgNum,
STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

The function is used to configure a receive message object.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgNum,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
  • CAN_STD_ID: The 11-bit identifier.
  • CAN_EXT_ID: The 29-bit identifier.
Return values:
FALSENo useful interface, TRUE Configure a receive message object success.

Definition at line 796 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_SetRxMsgObj ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgObj,
STR_CANMSG_R_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

Set Rx message object.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgObj,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
  • CAN_STD_ID (standard ID, 11-bit)
  • CAN_EXT_ID (extended ID, 29-bit)
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
TRUE,:SUCCESS, FALSE: No useful interface.

Definition at line 305 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

u32  MsgNum,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

The function is used to configure a transmit object.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgNum,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
FALSENo useful interface, TRUE Config message object success.

Definition at line 618 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_Transmit ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  MsgNum,
STR_CANMSG_T_TypeDef *  pCanMsg 
)

Send CAN message.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
MsgNum,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
pCanMsg,:Pointer to the message structure where received data is copied.
Return values:
FALSE,:1. When operation in basic mode: Transmit message time out. 2. When operation in normal mode: No useful interface. TRUE: Transmit Message success.

Definition at line 857 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

s32 CAN_TriggerTxMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx,
u32  u32MsgNum 
)

Set transmit request bit. If a transmission is requested by programming bit TxRqst/NewDat (IFn_CMASK[2]), the TxRqst (IFn_MCON[8]) will be ignored.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
u32MsgNum,:Specifies the Message object number, from 0 to 31.
Return values:
TRUE,:Start transmit message.

Definition at line 727 of file ht32f5xxxx_can.c.

void CAN_WaitMsg ( HT_CAN_TypeDef *  CANx)

This function is used to Wait message into message buffer in basic mode. Please notice the function is polling NEWDAT bit of MCR register by while loop and it is used in basic mode.

Parameters:
CANx,:The pointer to CAN module base address.
Return values:
None
